Hello Bitbucket Team!

I wanted to create a repository for our user acris-dev with the name "AcrisLastStockCustomerGroup". I was not possible, so an error page with the following code returned:

Code: b39af9e5d9f64b5d80e2f592862d90ca

When I tried this one time more, BitBucket told me that the name is already in use.

After that I also tried to create a repository with the name "AcrisLastStockCustomerGroups". But the same thing happend.

Thanks!\\
Christoph Pötz\\
christoph.poetz@acris.at

fields.description:
Currently, the default mysql service used by BitBucket in Pipelines, runs with a particular sql_mode and other configurations that are not the same as our developers or production environments. Being able to configure that (using a .cnf file) would be advantageous.

Whilst it is possible to set some of the options for the session, not all are possible and means that some configuration entries are different.
fields.summary: Add support for custom .cnf file for mysql service in pipeline

In any case, thanks for your help
fields.summary: Custom emoji in the new bitbucket slack integration

fields.description:
Hi!

Issue BCLOUD-8276 "README Markdown does not support internal links" was marked as resolved. However, the resolution shown is not a resolution, as it is counter to common industry practice, rendering Markdown files for Bitbucket incompatible with any other tool on the market.

The comments on the original issue elaborate on the necessity for cross-compatibility and offer an improvement on the bitbucket Markdown parser that would render it compatible with other common tools.

As for me, it necessitates maintaining two copies of documentation. It's easy to automate, but it would make sense to lift this burden from your customers, given that the fix should not be overly complex.
fields.summary: Issue #8276 marked as resolved, when is actually unresolved

fields.description:
# Resolve,  press Esc
# Workflow, click somewhere

Screencast: https://youtu.be/bGbZaPd3P2s
fields.summary: Unclosable overlay appears after clicking Workflow button

fields.description:
We have a build process which pulls dependencies from an adjacent, private Bitbucket repository.  I've configured the SSH access keys on the consuming project, its known_hosts and imported the public key to the upstream private project.

With a build containing two separate, identical build stanzas, the second calls to SSH or GIT are failing on some builds.  On other builds, the first calls fail as well.

I have verified that the ~/.ssh/config is pointing to the right SSH keys in /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/data/id_rsa (this appears to be bind-mounted in at:

/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/data/id_rsa -> ..data/id_rsa

As the behaviour is inconsistent and variable, I'm wondering if there may be an issue on your end?  Could there be a missing cache that is not mounting appropriately onto our build containers (stock)?  Is that path config working on your end as it looks like a strange symlink path from here.

Any insight greatly appreciated
fields.summary: SSH access to Bitbucket repositories via GIT failing inconsistently

(Customer suggestions)

1 add a option to select all files in git-lfs and delete them. Right now I would have to do it one by one.

2 would be a amazing to delete all files in git lfs, and then just uploaded the newest version. Of course this breaks git's intended purpose. However for my use case (game development) I only need the latest version of a file on git-lfs. The history of file doesn't matter to me.
fields.summary: LFS management (Customer suggestions)

fields.description:
Since branches cannot be deleted in Mercurial, it marks a branch head as closed by creating a commit  that normally it doesn't have any other changes in it.

Pipelines currently treats this as a change and starts a pipeline for it.\\
We need to have the ability to skip the Branch close commit build for Mercurial repos to avoid using up build minutes unnecessarily
fields.summary: Disable builds on branch close commit for Mercurial repos (BP-632)

fields.description:
When a file is pushed and contains a special character like "Â(194/00C2)" is does not render equally on an editor and raw mode.\\
Attached images showing the same char facing two behaviors.
fields.summary: Source code editor did not render properly characters from ref utf latin1 supplement

fields.description:
When viewing the list of branches for a repository it would often be helpful to have the user who made the last commit to that branch displayed in the UI, and also be filterable by that user. It would be even nicer if this was instead for all users who'd contributed to that branch.

The use case is when viewing the branch list I'm usually only interested in _my_ branches, and it can be difficult to pick out those that are mine and those by other developers.

A workaround is to use branch naming to include the name of the developer, but I don't think everyone uses this pattern and solid UI support would anyway be a much better feature.
fields.summary: List Branch Users

fields.description:
Hi,\\
We configured our test suites to run parallel using parallel pipeline feature.(https://blog.bitbucket.org/2018/03/27/speed-build-parallel-steps-pipelines/)

on our observation

Pipelines proceeds to {{deploy to test}} step if {{unit tests}}, {{integration test}} and {{browser tests}} are passed.

But lets take a situation where {{unit tests}} got failed. In that case another two parallel test continues till end and marked as failure at end. Instead we want to stop the pipeline immediately if any one of parallel test got failed.
fields.summary: Fast fail all parallel steps immediately if any one of parallel steps failed

fields.description:
Can a warning notification please be added when deleting Environment Variables?

I have accidentally deleted Environment variables several times this week by unintentionally clicking a Delete Icon.

This has occurred when:

* I have been using the scroll bar (which happens to be right where the delete icon is) to scroll through available Environment Variables
* I have clicked on the browser to change focus and unintentionally placed the click on one of the Delete Icons

This is more of an issue because there is no history of the environment variables because most of the time I didn't even know which Environment Variable I have accidentally deleted.
fields.summary: Add a warning notification when deleting Environment Variables

fields.description:
I get this message in build teardown:

{code}
#!

Cache "gradle": Skipping upload for existing cache
Cache "gradlewrapper": Compressing
Cache "gradlewrapper": Compressed in 10 seconds
Cache "gradlewrapper": Uploading 161 MB
Cache "gradlewrapper": Upload failed
{code}

My Pipeline is configured like this:

{code}
#!

image: java:8

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        caches:
          - gradle
          - gradlewrapper
        script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.
          # You must commit the Gradle wrapper to your repository
          # https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/gradle_wrapper.html
          - bash ./gradlew build
definitions:
  caches:
    gradlewrapper: ~/.gradle/wrapper
{code}

Any idea why this happens?

Seems to be in some way related to [#15634|BCLOUD-15634]
fields.summary: Upload of custom cache fails

fields.description:
The pull request view in Bitbucket really sucks. Would it be possible to make it more useable please?

Here are my specific complaints but a general redesign wouldn't go a miss:

* It is hard to navigate between the files, would it be possible to have the file list shown as a tree view on the left? The lack of ease of navigating between files makes it necessary to compress the files by missing chunks out. This makes it hard to see the context of a change. Though there is the three dot button to show more I'm often finding I have to press this multiple time to see the code I want.
* It generates emails as soon as I've added a comment. I'd rather it waited until I've finished my review and then sent a single email about all the comments I have made. All of Atlassian's products are designed to be spam engines so this problem isn't really surprising.
* It gives a side by side diff view, however it is not possible to add comments from this view. Which makes it a bit useless.
* No syntax highlighting (I'm using C# but I would expect most major languages to have syntax highlighting).
* Some of my colleagues insist on using very long lines in their code (300 characters at the extreme). I'd like to stop them but sadly I can't. However this means that the pull request view has the whole scroll bars within scroll bars issue (you can't scroll across without first scrolling down to find the horizontal scroll bar). Not quite sure what could be done about this, but having some way to only have one file on a page at a time would help with this.
fields.summary: The pull request view's usability sucks

fields.description:
Today some of my non admin developers had clicked on an already removed integration and re-enabled the integration again.

The integration was with Codacy (codacy.com)

# A point in time Codacy updated the status of a build of a PR.
# An Admin user removed the Codacy integration.
# A non Admin user can click on the status and jump to Codacy to see the results.
# Codacy requests OAuth integration to add the project back into Codacy. (see attachment)
# This then causes analysis of projects that had been removed by Admin user of bitbucket and updates the build status again.

*** Non Admin users should not be able to add integrations**

*** When an integration is removed, build status should be removed as well**

*** 3rd Party integrations should not request excessive permissions**
fields.summary: Non Admin user to a repository can modify the build process and build status

fields.description:
Environment variables available from pipeline steps are listed here:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/environment-variables-794502608.html

There doesn't seem to be a way to find out which deployment environment is set for this step at the moment (i.e., via fictional BITBUCKET_DEPLOYMENT variable). It is needed for deployment script to decide what to do; otherwise, steps can't be reused for different environments.

This enhancement is trivial to implement but will provide a great value, because it will dramatically facilitate the reuse of scripts, given that current abilities are limited to YAML anchors.
fields.summary: Make step deployment accessible as BITBUCKET_DEPLOYMENT variable in script

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a pull request's source branch has been deleted, a Javascript error prompts while editing the pull request.

###Steps to Reproduce

# Create branch A (add and push a file)
# Create branch B (add and push a file)
# Create a pull request from branch A to branch B
# Merge branch A and branch B to master branch
# Push to the remote repository
# Delete the branches A and B locally and to the remote repository
# Go to the created pull requests and try to edit it

###Actual Results\\
The below exception is thrown in the Chrome browser console log:

{code}
#!javascript

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'split' of null
at t.default (parse-compare-spec.js?b510:4)
at e (edit.js:255)
at e.Router.<anonymous> (edit.js:281)
at e.Router.<anonymous> (index.js:7363)
at i (director.js?a3c1:517)
at n (director.js?a3c1:298)
at e.Router.d.invoke (director.js?a3c1:522)
at r (director.js?a3c1:480)
at e.Router.d.dispatch (director.js?a3c1:492)
at e.Router.handler (director.js?a3c1:186)
at e.Router.d.init (director.js?a3c1:214)
at Object.3213 (pullrequests.js:44)
at t (bootstrap ca56b293ff22420f7f4d?fd03:52)
at Object.3719 (pullrequests.js:17278)
at t (bootstrap ca56b293ff22420f7f4d?fd03:52)
at window.webpackJsonp (bootstrap ca56b293ff22420f7f4d?fd03:23)
at pullrequests.js:1
{code}

###Workaround\\
No workaround yet
fields.summary: Javascript error while editing pull request with deleted source branch

fields.description:
h2. What I noticed
If you make a change to the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file on a branch, then the Pipelines run for that branch is run with that branch's version of the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file.

I understand this is fine for most cases, but in our case:

* Bitbucket Pipelines deploys changes to staging and production (trigger on master branch)

Therefore, if someone were to edit the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file on a branch without branch permissions enabled, then they could add the prod deploy steps to their branch trigger and deploy their branch to production.

That situation therefore isn't SOX compliant :disappointed:

h2. Question
Is there currently a way to maintain SOX compliance on changes going to prod via Bitbucket Pipelines? Perhaps I missed an option somewhere.

If not, is there any future work planned to add this level of SOX compliance?

Apologies if I missed something and I'm completely wrong :sweat_smile:
fields.summary: Apply compliance (SOX, etc) controls on the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file

fields.description:
We observed that when fetching a host’s fingerprint via Settings >> Pipelines >> SSH keys, the fingerprint Bitbucket retrieves is based on algorithm ssh-dss. This is no problem when using a Docker image which uses OpenSSH 6, but in OpenSSH 7, ssh-dss is disabled, due to its weakness (see https://www.openssh.com/legacy.html).\\
In our case, this had the effect that known_hosts did work when using the standard PHP image (Debian-based), but failed when using an Alpine image with OpenSSH 7 (with the usual “WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED”).

In other words: when fetching a host’s fingerprint, Bitbucket Cloud should prefer newer algorithms. For instance, when connecting to the very same host for which Bb Cloud retrieved an ssh-des fingerprint, both from my Mac _and_ from the aforementioned Alpine image, the host-key algorithm is ecdsa-sha2-nistp256 .
fields.summary: Bb Piplines Known Hosts: fingerprint uses weak algorithm

fields.description:
Sporadically I get this error when pulling from a private repo to 1 or more of my virtual machines (Fedora/Linux Mint/Centos 7). See below. Retrying the command a few seconds later makes things work !!

First try fails:

✔ ~/repos/emacs_init_el [master|✔]\\
22:48 $ git pull\\
error: cannot lock ref 'refs/remotes/origin/master': is at 95f898b8d0cd4724b37f074456127d0e62ead43c but expected c0b18ba12cde6130dcf005631c84b7a166661fb1\\
From bitbucket.org:pymaximus/emacs_init_el\\
! c0b18ba..95f898b  master     -> origin/master  (unable to update local ref)

Second try a few seconds later is successful:

✘-1 ~/repos/emacs_init_el [master ↓·1|✔]\\
22:48 $ git pull\\
Updating c0b18ba..95f898b\\
Fast-forward\\
init.el | 3 +++\\
1 file changed, 3 insertions(+)\\
✔ ~/repos/emacs_init_el [master|✔]\\
22:48 $
fields.summary: error: cannot lock ref 'refs/remotes/origin/master'

fields.description:
The bitbucket code search is an awesome tool that my team uses quite often. However it is limiting in one major area for us, not allowing a '-' as part of the search term (ie attribute-service, api-gateway, attribute-client, etc.).

A majority of npm packages use a '-' as a name delimiter. Our organization has followed this same pattern with all of our node-based repo names and application names.

We are using a microservice architecture so we are constantly referencing our other applications all throughout our codebases. These references are not isolated to a package.json file but spread across our applications so there are no short term strategies around this that I have found.

Please add the ability to allow a '-' in the code searches. Not having this capability has forces my team to resort to pulling down all of our applications and using the local file system search which doesn't come with the nice functionality
fields.summary: Allow - in bitbucket code searches

fields.description:
So that we can write complex pipelines while keeping the file clean and readable.

Supported in YAML 1.1, docs: http://yaml.org/type/merge.html

*Example:*

{code:yaml}
image: user/my-image:latest

x-run-tests:
  &run-tests
    name: Run tests
    services:
      - docker
    script:
      - ./test.sh

x-deploy-to-staging:
  &deploy-to-staging
    name: Deploy to staging
    deployment: staging
    trigger: manual
    script:
      - ./deploy.sh user@staging.com

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        <<: *run-tests

    - step:
        <<: *deploy-to-staging

  branches:
    develop:
      - step:
          <<: *run-tests

      - step:
          <<: *deploy-to-staging
          trigger: auto

    master:
      - step:
          <<: *run-tests
      - step:
          name: Deploy to production
          deployment: production
          trigger: manual
          script:
            - ./deploy.sh user@example.com
{code}
fields.summary: Support YAML merge format in `bitbucket-pipelines.yml`

fields.description:
hi

I tried to transfer a private repo to my companies team account, which Im an admin for. On the 'accept transfer' screen, I was unable to select a destination project and the "Accept" button remained greyed out.

The only clue as to what was going on was a tooltip with text something like "cannot transfer to a private project if the repo has public issue tracker, wiki etc".

I managed to workaround it by revoking the transfer, changing the repos issue tracker to private and transferring again.

I think this is a bug, and that the 'accept transfer' UI in this case should:

* when a private project is selected, offer to change the offending item (issue tracker or whatever) to private

Further, I think that when an issue tracker is enabled for a private  repo, it should be private by default
fields.summary: repo transfer cannot be accepted if the repo has a public issue tracker / wiki etc

fields.description:
commands and output:

$ git submodule init\\
$ git submodule update

bq. fatal: reference is not a tree: 556d36557cf01ae80709eb42b52a316d683dd864\\
Unable to checkout '556d36557cf01ae80709eb42b52a316d683dd864' in submodule path 'dockers'


git version: 2.7.4

offending repos:

* git@bitbucket.org:tdtco/odoo-toolkit.git
* git@bitbucket.org:tdtco/dockers.git

the reference is to my last commit on dockers repo. Can't use the submodules command to download the dockers automatically as I'm getting the error on top.

(maybe) Important: I'm using the access keys feature on both repos, and there is a submodule inside the submodule
fields.summary: cannot download git submodule over ssh

fields.description:
We use Bitbucket cloud to trigger Bamboo server jobs and as such changes to the IP addresses (like the recent addition of 34.198.203.127, 34.198.178.64, 34.198.32.85) require changes to our trigger IP addresses in order to keep everything working.

According to https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/what-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall-343343385.html\\
"These IP addresses could change at any time. You can watch this page or our blog for updates. Our DNS entry is the trusted source of information for our current IP. "\\
It seems unreasonable to force users to constantly seek out this information. Why not offer a subscription email specifically for these alerts?

Even with advanced notification, manually updating all Bamboo server triggers can be a significant effort. It would be much better if this could be automated. Amazon's web services offer such a tool for keeping our firewall rules up-to-date, perhaps something similar could be added to Bamboo server?
fields.summary: No easy way keep Valid IP addresses for bitbucket.org up-to-date in Bamboo triggers

fields.description: I've been having issues creating a tag for a given commit, but sometimes it fails, It is because the description or message associated with the tag has characters with accetns like 'descripción'
fields.summary: Can't create a tag with a description with accents

fields.description:
On our team we switch a lot between projects, but navigating projects is bothersome, since the first breadcrumb link (the team name) from a project or repository detail page navigates back to the overview instead of the projects page.

The following are suggestions to what could be done to improve this:

# The team name link in the breadcrumbs link to the project page
# Filter by the owner and project when returning to the overview after clicking the team name link in the breadcrumbs
# The team name link gives you a dropdown where you can choose between {{Overview}}, {{Overview (filtered)}} or {{Projects}}
# Make behaviour configurable
fields.summary: Breadcrumbs on detail pages are unintuitive

fields.description:
Deleting a tag in bitbucket with a tag name in this format "[number].[number]" (for example "2018.2" - without quotes) does not delete the tag. Checking the browser console shows the following error:

*Uncaught TypeError: x.split is not a function*

{code}
at HTMLButtonElement.E (commit-tags.js?_statichash=2274d10a025a7dd6f3dd02be71cc27d4-T%2F-1529727173%2Fdfbc6ae%2F1%2Fa83c44da582b901f87e581a338159268&analytics-enabled=true&analytics-uploadable=true&locale=en-US&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-enabled=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&supportedApplication=true:3)
at HTMLDocument.dispatch (batch.js:28)
at HTMLDocument.r.handle (batch.js:28)
{code}

We use these tags at my organisation to denote releases (e.g. first release of 2018 is "2018.1" etc).
fields.summary: Unable to delete some tags

fields.description:
When we update the label of a SSH Key in our Team Account, the key will be removed and transferred to the Individual Bitbucket Account, but there's no indication that this has happened. Trying to add the key again fails because it already exists in the individual user settings.

h4. Workaround
Remove the SSH Key from the Individual Bitbucket Account and add it back to the Team Account.
fields.summary: Team SSH Key gets transferred to personal account when label is updated

fields.description:
Where the repo has a large number of issues, the exported ZIP file (1 GB+) becomes corrupt.\\
After the download, the zip file cannot be un-zipped and if you try to use the exported file to import the issues into a different repo, you get an error "BadZipfile: File is not a zip file"
fields.summary: Exporting large amount of Issues from BB cloud repo - produced a corrupt ZIP file

fields.description:
Per the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/using-branch-permissions-776639807.html], it appears that I should be able to add Branch Permission from a project level.

However, when viewing my projects, I don't see any setting for this. Has this been removed?

I would like to update my projects to restrict write to the master branch without having to go into 40+ repositories individually.
fields.summary: No Project Setting for Branch Permissions

fields.description: When attempting to leave a blank comment on a PR the error message is displayed as HTML. See attached png.
fields.summary: Empty comment error is in HTML

fields.description:
Hi,

I have found that when i want to add/invite users into the system, currently it searches whole bitbucket cloud world. I think it is a serious security issue. It would be good if it restricted to specific domain(organisation).

Thanks and Regards\\
Satya
fields.summary: User base restriction to specific organisation domain

fields.description: When I use git mv to rename a file and then edit content of the file, the file is displayed as a new file and previous file as deleted in "Diff" rather than a moved/renamed file, making it impossible to see the changes in "Diff". What make things even more confusing is that when the amount of change is small the file is displayed as renamed and changes are displayed when "Diff" tab is selected.
fields.summary: Moved files are displayed as new files

fields.description:
You cannot access your account in settings because it is physically off the screen and the menu is hidden. Any attempts to get to it are thwarted by the iOS dock.

Solution is to add a media query for Apple device resolutions specifically.
fields.summary: Bitcucket Settings Inaccesible on iPad Pro 10.5 Due to CSS Issue

fields.description:
When 2 branches do not have a common Ancestor , when creating a Pull Request to merge them, Bitbucket will not display the Diff.\\
We will show a warning "We couldn't load the Diff" and once PR is created we will say "Nothing to merge as one of the branches were deleted"  however they were not.\\
In the DevTools logs we will see an error:\\
" Error: fatal: refusing to merge unrelated histories"

*Workaround is:*\\
do the merge locally by running:\\
git pull origin master --allow-unrelated-histories\\
git merge origin origin/master\\
add and commit\\
pit push origin master

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37937984/git-refusing-to-merge-unrelated-histories-on-rebase
fields.summary: Support Git merge  for branches with unrelated histories

fields.description: Can't currently update branch permissions on repos.
fields.summary: Branch Permission

fields.description:
When definition lists are rendered, they lack the preceding whitespace of other types of lists, and even paragraphs. This makes them look "crammed" into the text above, particularly with headings. I believe the relevant documentation page for definition lists is [here|https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/definition_lists/]. Examples:

h2. h2 heading
This is some text of a normal paragraph, definition list follows.

def 1\\
:   definition of def1

def 2\\
:   etc

h2. here is another h2 heading
* this is how a ul list is rendered

h2. and another h2 heading
def 1\\
:   this is how a defn list is rendered. that 'def 1' is practically hidden up there!

The behaviour that concerns me is in a readme file that is being rendered, but the whitespace issue seems to occur in this issue tracker as well.
fields.summary: Definition lists lack preceding vertical whitespace

fields.description:
We have {{*.md}} files in our Bitbucket repo that contain images. We typically put the images in an {{images}} subdirectory.

For, example:

* {{images/logo.png}}
* {{README.md}} contains {{![Logo](images/logo.png)}}

This older issue discussed the original problem:\\
BCLOUD-6589

The recent broken markdown images are due to a regression when turning on the *New source browser experience* via setting on *Labs* page.

*Expectation:* When rendering markdown, the relative path in an image link should be rewritten so that the web browser loads the *raw* version of image and not the image viewer HTML page.
fields.summary: Relative image links broken in markdown files when using "New source browser experience"

Got this error: c0911d9abb4c4cd2830918edfd33eebf\\
Please let me know the reason
fields.summary: Got Error while trying to download repo

fields.description: In the UI, the tag name is a draggable hyperlink which makes copy+paste a PITA. Normally I look under Commits, I click the branch selector drop down, then click the "tags" tab and I can't highlight the tags because the row has some drag feature that prevents selection. If the tag name is non-trival, its vital to have a copy+paste option. I literally had to open the DOM inspector to copy and paste tags
fields.summary: How do you copy and paste a tag name?

fields.description:
Deployment of Pipelines could be much easier ...

To improve the Workflow you should add a Buttons to the deployment page, to deploy a pipeline with a simple click.
fields.summary: Make deployments easier

fields.description:
It would be nice to run the deployment with multiple steps in the same Docker machine.

# Install all requirements
# Deployment Step 1
# Deployment Step 2\\
...

In this way it would be easier to run a deployment and see in a few seconds at which step my deployment fails.

That the moment i have to create a Pipeline with one step and run every step of the deployment in a single script.
fields.summary: Run multiple Steps in the same Docker Container

git fetch --tags --progress git@bitbucket.org:cloudbeds/myfrontdesk-front.git +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*

Variables can't be gotten back
fields.summary: Easy to accidentally click the delete button on environment variables

Error's displayed with html tags.

!1209368730-download.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Error displayed with html tags

fields.description:
I would like to request an addition to the code search feature referred to in issue [#2874|BCLOUD-2874].

In my team, we are using the wiki as a sort of triage. Support requests are generally documented with resolution steps in the wiki. However, because of the inability to search the wiki it is proving very difficult.

Therefore, I'd like to request an enhancement to the search functionality referenced in the above issue so that it is extended to also include the wiki for the repository in question.
fields.summary: Add search functionality to repository wikis.

fields.description:
For context, our team has been using custom pipelines to do our deployments. Once all requirements are met in our staging build (all tests pass, build checks successful, etc...) any one of us can select the custom pipeline that essentially deploys everything to production.

We like the simplicity of this setup and it's been working well for us, but some of our larger clients and stakeholders expressed some concerns. They wanted a sort of two-man rule - where specific actions (like deployment) needed two people acting together in order to execute the said action.

Its clear to us that they are concerned about someone from our team going rogue or making a mistake and clicking the wrong custom pipeline. If there is a way to do this with the current feature set please let me know, but otherwise, I think this might add some security value.

As for how - maybe something similar to how pull requests can have a rule where at least one other person must approve before code get merged. Thoughts?
fields.summary: Create a mechanism that prevents a single user from executing a custom pipeline or deployment

fields.description:
In Bitbucket Settings, there is currently the Added field. However, even if the SSH Key label is updated, the Added Date field will shows as just updated. This can be confusing as user would think that their SSH Key was recently added.

It would be good if we can add a "Updated" field which shows the date the SSH Key label was updated rather than changing the Added date.
fields.summary: For SSH Key in Bitbucket Settings, add a new field for updated date

fields.description: We are using Bitbucket to host our closed source Java projects at my company, and we have Bitbucket pipelines turned on for all them. These are Maven projects that use the popular Jacoco plugin to automatically create test coverage reports. I see that the Pipelines automatically pick up test results information from Maven's failsafe and surefire plugins. Being able to view Jacoco reports as well would be awesome. At a minimum, it would really help the effectiveness and efficiency of our code review process if we are able to view the coverage percentage for each pipeline build.
fields.summary: Show code coverage reports for Jacoco, Cobertura and others

fields.description:
When a build is running and completed, upon clicking "Pipelines" on the top of the build page which would take us back to the Pipelines Dashboard. On the pipelines dashboard, it shows as the build is still running even though it has completed. Upon refreshing the page, then it shows the correct status.

!1692257326-2.PNG|thumbnail!

!1938490040-1.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Build shows as in progress when completed on pipelines dashboard

fields.description:
We are using internally Bitbucket Pull request for our project development.

This page https://bitbucket.org/Name/project-name/pull-requests/

To see changes in this page we have to refresh this page. I think it would be better if this page could update dynamically its content without pressing refresh button.
fields.summary: Dynamically update the PR page to prevent the need for page refreshes
